message: Also check out Gargoyle https://github.com/disqus/gargoyle its like admin interface for switching features on and off
Don't know about CodeIgniter but in django we kinda do this. With virtualenv + pip

Don't know if anyone has tried HMVC extension for CodeIgniter (previously on... I was a php developer :P), it should be good if there were something similar for Django. (something to split a project on simple installable/uninstallable modules). Is there any way to install/uninstall apps in a project using a web-admin-interface?.

Apps are enabled or disabled by their inclusion in the settings file, not generally via a webapp (though you could have another app which provides settings data to the main one or something, that would be silly though).
@coderanger I never actually used gargoyle, just pointed out its existence.
there are some front-end settings manager apps floating around, I don't know if they let you modify the installed apps setting though
